abstract: Telemundo, which has long trailed its rival Univision in battle for Hispanic television viewers, is embracing a new strategy of combining English-language subtitles and Spanglish to attract deep-pocketed viewers and advertisers; new approach reflects the changing dynamics of Hispanics across the country.
snippet: The network is planning to show English-language subtitles in an effort to attract viewers among the skyrocketing number of second- and third-generation Hispanic-Americans.
lead_paragraph: The network is planning to show English-language subtitles in an effort to attract viewers among the skyrocketing number of second- and third-generation Hispanic-Americans.

headline.main: Telemundo Blends English Into a Mostly Spanish Lineup
headline.print_headline: Telemundo Blends English Into a Mostly Spanish Lineup
headline.seo: Telemundo Seeks Spanglish Speakers, Aiming for New Viewers
